RWC5020x API Library

RWC5020x Code Documentation¶

RWCApi class file contains the set of methods to send commands and receive response from RWC5020x LoRa Tester.

class rwclib.cRWC5020x.RWCTesterApi(port, addr=None)¶
class RWCTesterApi¶

This is class file to send commands and receive response from RWC5020x LoRa Tester via RS232 Port.

Class Methods:

query_identification()¶

Identification query command

Parameters:N/A
Returns:Name, Version and Serial No. of the device; NAK on failure
reset()¶

Preset the equipment fully

Parameters:N/A
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
save(index)¶

Save the current parameters setting to memory

Parameters:value – setting value (1 ~ 10)
Returns:None
recall(index)¶

Recall the saved parameters setting from memory

Parameters:value – setting value (1 ~ 10)
Returns:None
set_mode(mode)¶

Configure an operating mode (or Main Menu) of RWC5020A

Parameters:mode – Testing mode (EDT, GWT, NST)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
query_mode()¶

Read the operating mode (or Main Menu) of RWC5020A

Parameters:N/A (Query only)
Returns:It returns the operating mode; NAK on failure
set_remotelock(status)¶

Lock the key input during Remote Control

Parameters:status – remote lock status (OFF, ON)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
query_remotelock()¶

Unlock the key input during Remote Control

Parameters:N/A (Query only)
Returns:It returns the status of key input during remote control; NAK on failure
set_screen(submenu)¶

Configure a screen (or Sub Menu) of RWC5020A to move directly to another sub menu

Parameters:submenu – sub menu type (LINK, POWER_TIME, POWER_CHANNEL, SENSITIVITY, REMOTE)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
rf_setfrequency(freqrange)¶

Configure CW frequency in MHz for non-signaling test

Parameters:freqrange – Frequency range (400~510, 862~960)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
rf_getfrequency()¶

Read CW frequency in MHz for non-signaling test

Parameters:Query only
Returns:It returns the frequency in MHz; NAK on failure

Returns:It returns the frequency in MHz; NAK on failure

rf_getrxfrequency()¶

Returns:It returns the frequency in MHz; NAK on failure

rf_getmfgfrequency()¶

rf_setchannelmask(chindexrange, chmaskrange)¶

Configure the channel mask of channel index 0 in both EDT and GWT mode

Parameters:
  • chindexrange – Channel index (0 - 5)
  • chmaskrange – Channel Mask (For EDT 0x00 ~ 0xFF, For GWT 0x00 ~ 0xFFFF(US/AU/CN), read-only (others))
Returns:

ACK on success, NAK on failure
rf_getchannelmask(chindexrange)¶

Read the channel mask of channel index 0 in both EDT and GWT mode

Parameters:chindexrange – Channel index (0 - 5)
Returns:It returns the channel mask with respect to the channel index; NAK on failure
rf_setchannelgroup(chgrouprange)¶

Configure the channel group (only applicable to US/AU/CN in EDT mode)

Param:For US/AU, 00 ~ 07, 08 ~ 15, 16 ~ 23, 24 ~ 31, … , 48 ~ 55, 56 ~ 63, For CN, 00 ~ 07, 08 ~ 15, 16 ~ 23, 24 ~ 31, … , 80 ~ 87, 88 ~ 95
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
rf_getchannelgroup()¶

Read the channel group (only applicable to US/AU/CN in EDT mode)

Parameters:N/A (Query only)
Returns:It returns the channel group of US/AU/CN region; NAK on failure
rf_setuplinkchannel(ulchfreqrange)¶

Write uplink Channel n frequency in MHz;

For EDT param=3 (EU868, IN) param=4 (EU433, KR, AS) For GWT all channels frequencies are editable

Parameters:ulchfreqrange – Frequency range (400~510, 862~960)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
rf_getuplinkchannel()¶

Read Uplink Channel n frequency in MHz

  • param=0,1,…,71 (US/AU)
  • param=0,1,…,95 (CN)
  • param=0,1,…,7 (others)
Parameters:N/A (Query only)
Returns:
rf_getdownlinkchannel()¶

Read Downlink Channel n frequency in MHz

  • param=0,1,…,47 (CN)
  • param=0,1,…,7 (others)
Parameters:N/A (Query only)
Returns:

For S/W Version 1.170 - 1.305: DR0_SF12BW125, DR1_SF11BW125, DR2_SF10BW125, DR3_SF9BW125, DR4_SF8BW125, DR5_SF7BW125, DR6_SF7BW250, DR7_FSK50

  • macnum – MAC Command Number
  • dutcmd –

    For EDT, DEV_STATUS, LINK_ADR, DUTY_CYCLE, RX_PARAM_SETUP, TX_PARAM_SETUP, NEW_CHANNEL, DL_CHANNEL, RX_TIMING_SETUP, USER_DEFINED, ACTIVATE_TM, DEACTIVATE_TM, CONFIRMED_TM, UNCONFIRMED_TM, ECHO_REQUEST_TM, TRIGGER_JOIN_REQ_TM, ENABLE_CW_MODE_TM, BEACON_FREQ, PING_SLOT_CH, FORCE_REJOIN, REJOIN_SETUP, ADR_SETUP

    For GWT, LINK_CHECK, DEVICE_TIME, DEVICE_MODE, RESET_IND

link_setbeaconfrequency(*args)¶

Configure the frequency value of Beacon frame

Parameters:*args –

For version below 1.17 only frequency required (0, 862 ~ 960 MHz)

For version 1.17 and above: first parameter should be a MAC command number, second parameter should be frequency (0, 862 ~ 960 MHz)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure

Read the frequency value of Beacon frame

Parameters:*args –

MAC Command Number required if version 1.17 and above otherwise parameter not required
Returns:It returns the frequency value; NAK on failure

link_setpingdatarate(*args)¶

Configure the index of the Data Rate used for ping-slot downlinks for PingSlotChannelReq (above v1.160)

Parameters:*args –

For version below 1.17 only datarate required

For version 1.17 and above: first parameter should be a MAC command number, second parameter should be datarate

(DR0_SF12BW125, DR1_SF11BW125,
DR2_SF10BW125, DR3_SF9BW125, DR4_SF8BW125, DR5_SF7BW125, DR6_SF7BW250, DR7_FSK50)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure

link_setpayloadlength(*args)¶

Configure the length of payload in bytes in EchoRequest Command

Parameters:*args –

For version below 1.17 only length required (1 ~ 242)

For version 1.17 and above: first parameter should be a MAC command number, second parameter should be length (1 ~ 242)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
link_getpayloadlength(*args)¶

Read the length of payload in bytes in EchoRequest Command

Parameters:*args –

MAC Command Number if version is 1.17 and above, otherwise parameter not required
Returns:It returns the payload length; NAK on failure

Parameters:value – 250-byte HEX value
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure

Param:Query only
Returns:It returns the payload data; NAK on failure
link_setcwtimeout(*args)¶

Configure the timeout of CW transmission in Enable Continuous Wave Mode command

Parameters:*args –

For version below 1.17 only time required (1 ~ 255)

For version 1.17 and above: first parameter should be a MAC command number, second parameter should be time (1 ~ 255)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure
link_getcwtimeout(*args)¶

Read the timeout of CW transmission in Enable Continuous Wave Mode command

Parameters:*args –

MAC Command Number if version is 1.17 and above, otherwise parameter not required
Returns:It returns the CW timeout value; NAK on failure
link_setcwfrequency(*args)¶

Configure the frequency of CW signal in Enable Continuous Wave Mode command

Parameters:*args –

For version below 1.17 only frequency required (400 ~ 510 MHz, 862 ~ 960 MHz)

For version 1.17 and above: first parameter should be a MAC command number, second parameter should be frequency (400 ~ 510 MHz, 862 ~ 960 MHz)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure

Read the frequency of CW signal in Enable Continuous Wave Mode command

Parameters:*args –

MAC Command Number if version is 1.17 and above, otherwise parameter not required
Returns:It returns the CW frequency value; NAK on failure

Configure the power of CW signal in dBm in Enable Continuous Wave Mode command

Parameters:*args –

For version below 1.17 only power required (0 ~ 40)

For version 1.17 and above: first parameter should be a MAC command number, second parameter should be power (0 ~ 40)
Returns:ACK on success, NAK on failure

Returns:It returns status message; NAK on failure
